reference.title: Overview Statistical Functions
reference.shortdesc: An overview of some functions for statistics.

section.title: COUNT
section.p: This function returns the number of numeric values in a supplied set of cells or values. This count includes both numbers and dates.

plentry.pd: Required. Can be any values or references to cell ranges.

section.title: COUNTIF
section.p: This function returns the number of cells of a supplied range, that satisfy given criteria.

plentry.pd: Required. The range of cells that should be tested.
Required. A user-defined condition that is tested against each of the cells in a range.

section.title: AVERAGE
section.p: This function calculates the arithmetic mean of the supplied numbers.

plentry.pd: Required. A set of one or more numeric values, arrays of numeric values or references to cells or cell ranges with numeric values.

section.title: MAX
section.p: This function returns the largest value from a list of supplied numbers.

plentry.pd: Required. A set of one or more numeric values, arrays of numeric values or references to cells or cell ranges with numeric values.

section.title: MIN
section.p: This function returns the smallest value from a list of supplied numbers.

plentry.pd: Required. A set of one or more numeric values, arrays of numeric values or references to cells or cell ranges with numeric values.

section.title: SLOPE
section.p: This function calculates the slope of the linear regression line through a supplied set of x- and y- values.

plentry.pd: Required. An array of known y-values
Required. An array of known x-values

section.title: INTERCEPT
section.p: This function calculates the intercept of the linear regression line through a supplied set of x- and y- values.

plentry.pd: Required. An array of known y-values
Required. An array of known x-values
